intro: Scleria boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian umbrella sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a rosette at the base. Scleria boliviana is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along riverbanks.
